intro: Polyachyrus poeppigii subsp. multifidus, commonly known as the multilobe polyachyrus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, often hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
